page.title: 17Clyndu Farm
page.content: Clyndu Farm (34acres) has been farmed for a hundred years, but today it is a Riding School.It was opened in March 1978.There are twenty horses and ponies. The horses include thorough- breds, Shetlands, Welsh-Mountain ponies, Hunters and Welsh cobs. Children, adults, organizations including the Pony Club, Local Schools and Break Thro use the riding school. Mrs Vaughan Jones, the owner, dresses as Father Christmas every year and rides down to Pembrey School. All the children 'look out' for Father Christmas and there's great excitement when he comes into view. Ben,the horse is an important guest at the party and is fed many tasty tit bits. Christmas wouldn't the same in Pembrey without Father Christmas and Ben.
